full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 Extended BENEFIT SUMMARY CHART Extended Benefits Patient Balance Benefits ROOM AND BOARD: 80% of the charge from the 121st day You pay 20% of the charge from the 121st day in each benefit (continued) in each benefit period. period. SPECIAL SERVICES: 80% of the charge from the 121st day You pay 20% of the charge from the 121st day in each benefit in each benefit period. period. If you are in a private room, we will only provide benefits for: 80% of the hospital's average charge for a semiprivate room: AND 80% of the maximum semiprivate charge for special services. You pay the balance. IMPORTANT: The benefits described in this section may also be available in a participating skilled nursing facility. But they are available ONLY when your condition is such that you would otherwise require covered inpatient care in a participating general hospital. These benefits are NOT available for the treatment of mental disorders. We will also provide benefits up to the reasonable charge for ambulance service to transport you between the participating general hospital and the nearest participating skilled nursing facility and back. when needed. The ambulance service must have a reimbursement agreement with Blue Cross. Services by a chair car or air ambulance are NOT covered. For benefits in a non-participating general hospital, see page 13. 2. AS AN INPATIENT FOR PARTICIPATING PHYSICIANS' AND PSYCHOLOGISTS SERVICES IN A PARTICIPATING GENERAL HOSPITAL: You have the right to benefits as follows: BENEFIT SUMMARY CHART Extended Benefits Patient Balance 80% of a usual and customary charge for (i) physicians You pay 20% of a usual and customary charge for the care services as described in A. through F. below and (ii) for described in A. through F. below from the 121st day in each psychologists' services as described in E. below from the 121st benefit period. day in each benefit period. A. Medical care. B. Consultation services bv a physician other than the attending physician. C. Services to interpret diagnostic x-ray and lab tests. Page 7 D. Services by a physician. other than the attending physician. which are required for only a limited period of hours to treat an unusual aspect or complication of an illness or injury.
